alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 12:58PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall that fell earlier today continues. * WHERE...southern, west-central and northwestern Luce County in Upper Michigan. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. Minor water flows over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated the heavy rain has ended, but any minor flooding that is ongoing in the advisory area will continue into the mid-afternoon hours. Between 1.75 and 3.5 inches of rain fell earlier today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newberry, McMillan, Muskallonge State Park, Four Mile Corner, Dollarville, Pine Stump Junction, Helmer, Deer Park and Soo Junction. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
